body_html:
@csarofeen LSTMCells never use cuDNN at the moment. You have to use the full nn.LSTM container for that.

I think this is a very important issue, and I wouldn't like to make any decisions in rush. I'd rather think for a while and come up with a very good API, that will be here to stay. Otherwise we can end up with a bunch of legacy stuff waiting to be deleted (or lots of broken checkpoints). If you guys have any ideas, code examples (like the one above, thanks a lot for that), wishes or comments, I think it's best to keep them in here or in a separate slack channel. We're probably going to discuss some of them this week.
